Due to a continuation of bizarre and unwelcome events in 2020 thus far, I hearby dedicate today Friday, April 17th a SNOW DAY in honor of the Class of 2020 as you did not get one your senior year. Please consider this snow day declaration as a symbolic gesture to our seniors.

Our students are missing out on various activities and events with each passing day. We salute those who have embraced the spirit of learning during this time displaying character, determination and resiliency.

As another symbolic gesture of our support for the Class of 2020, many schools across the nation are lighting their stadium lights tonight at 8:20pm (20:20 military time) for 20 minutes. We will provide a facebook live feed on the PTHS fb page from Williamson Field to share positive comments of encouragement.

In conclusion, I hope the symbolic snow day will be enjoyed. Kick back with a hot cocoa and dream of better days and a bright future ahead. We miss you all!

Sincerely,

Jon Kilgore, Superintendent
Pontiac Twp. High School District 90

Teachers will vary, but most often it will be Ms. Hatfield (English) and Mr. Campbell (Math and Global Studies). While the teachers have their strengths, they are also willing to help you with any other subject.

Various students, freshman through seniors, attend based on need. Everyone is welcome.

World Oceans Day
June 2, 2019 at 6:33 PM ·

Hey everyone - it's Baylee! 👱🏼‍♀️ #SeasTheDay is back with an exciting #WorldOceansDay update for you! 🌎

Did you know #WorldOceansDay is in 6 DAYS?? Of course you do! Do you have any plans? Are you doing anything cool? WELL if you don't have any plans for June 8, it isn't too late. 🙌

Over the weekend, I celebrated World Oceans Day a little bit early with the students at Pontiac Township High School. These cool conservation leaders spent two weeks building a raft from 720 plastic bottles found in their school's cafeteria. 🤭 The students wanted to show how plastic from landlocked communities contributes largely to the global plastic pollution epidemic. 🚫

Even though there is only 6 days until June 8, there is still time to do something JUST as cool! As long as you explore your connection to the big blue and celebrate its importance, YOU are making a difference this #WorldOceansDay and all year round. 💙
